class.name: SimulationManagementFamilyPdu
class.comment: First part of a simulation management (SIMAN) PDU and SIMAN-Reliability (SIMAN-R) PDU. Sectionn 6.2.81

attribute.name: originatingID
attribute.comment: IDs the simulation or entity, either a simulation or an entity. Either 6.2.80 or 6.2.28

attribute.name: receivingID
attribute.comment: simulation, all simulations, a special ID, or an entity. See 5.6.5 and 5.12.4

class.name: CreateEntityPdu
class.comment: Section 7.5.2. Create a new entity. See 5.6.5.2.

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: Identifier for the request. See 6.2.75

class.name: RemoveEntityPdu
class.comment: Section 7.5.3 The removal of an entity from an exercise shall be communicated with a Remove Entity PDU. See 5.6.5.3.

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the specific and unique start/resume request being made by the SM

class.name: StartResumePdu
class.comment: Section 7.5.4. Start or resume an entity or exercise. See 5.6.5.4.

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the real-world time (UTC) at which the entity is to start/resume in the exercise. This information shall be used by the participating simulation applications to start/resume an exercise synchronously. This field shall be represented by a Clock Time record (see 6.2.16).

attribute.name: simulationTime
attribute.comment: The reference time within a simulation exercise. This time is established ahead of time by simulation management and is common to all participants in a particular exercise. Simulation time may be either Absolute Time or Relative Time. This field shall be represented by a Clock Time record (see 6.2.16)

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: Identifier for the specific and unique start/resume request

class.name: StopFreezePdu
class.comment: Section 7.5.5. Stop or freeze an enity or exercise. See 5.6.5.5

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: real-world(UTC) time at which the entity shall stop or freeze in the exercise

attribute.name: reason
attribute.comment: Reason the simulation was stopped or frozen (see section 7 of SISO-REF-010) represented by an 8-bit enumeration

attribute.name: frozenBehavior
attribute.comment: Internal behavior of the entity(or simulation) and its appearance while frozen to the other participants

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: Request ID that is unique

class.name: AcknowledgePdu
class.comment: 7.5.6 Acknowledges the receipt of a Start/Resume PDU, Stop/Freeze PDU, Create Entity PDU, or Remove Entity PDU. See 5.6.5.6.

attribute.name: acknowledgeFlag
attribute.comment: type of message being acknowledged

attribute.name: responseFlag
attribute.comment: Whether or not the receiving entity was able to comply with the request

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: Request ID that is unique

class.name: ActionRequestPdu
class.comment: 7.5.7 A request from an SM to a managed entity to perform a specified action. See 5.6.5.7

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: identifies the request being made by the simulation manager

attribute.name: actionID
attribute.comment: identifies the particular action being requested(see Section 7 of SISO-REF-010).

attribute.name: numberOfFixedDatumRecords
attribute.comment: Number of fixed datum records

attribute.name: numberOfVariableDatumRecords
attribute.comment: Number of variable datum records, handled automatically by marshaller at run time (and not modifiable by end-user programmers)

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums
